merged.Abdominal Tenderness: Occurs due to immune-mediated inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract or pancreas.
merged.Bruising: Caused by low platelet counts from immune-mediated thrombocytopenia or coagulation abnormalities.
merged.Conjunctival Injection: Results from immune-mediated inflammation of ocular tissues in uveitis.
merged.Cyanosis: Results from hypoxia due to pneumonitis or cardiac dysfunction.
merged.Decreased Reflexes: Results from immune-mediated neurological toxicities or peripheral neuropathy.
merged.Digital Clubbing: Develops as a response to chronic hypoxia or severe pulmonary disease.
merged.Dry Mucous Membranes: Caused by dehydration due to diarrhea, vomiting, or endocrine dysfunction.
merged.Edema: Results from renal dysfunction or cardiac involvement leading to fluid retention.
merged.Fever: Caused by systemic immune activation and inflammation.
merged.Hepatomegaly: Caused by immune-mediated liver inflammation or systemic immune activation.
merged.Hypotension: Occurs due to adrenal insufficiency, systemic inflammation, or severe dehydration.
merged.Jaundice: Caused by impaired liver function due to immune-mediated hepatitis.
merged.Lymphadenopathy: Occurs due to systemic immune activation or inflammation.
merged.Pallor: Results from anemia due to hemolytic processes or bone marrow suppression.
merged.Proximal Muscle Weakness: Caused by immune-mediated myopathy or neurological involvement.
merged.Rash: Results from immune-mediated inflammation of the skin in dermatitis.
merged.Splenomegaly: Occurs due to immune activation or hemolytic processes affecting the spleen.
merged.Tachycardia: Results from systemic inflammation, adrenal insufficiency, or cardiac involvement such as myocarditis.
merged.Weight Loss: Results from chronic inflammation, gastrointestinal dysfunction, or reduced nutrient absorption.
merged.Wheezing: Caused by airway inflammation or obstruction in pneumonitis.
